[File: aptos-core/storage/storage-interface/src/lib.rs] [Function: get_account_ordered_transactions()] [Event Consistency] When include_events=true, are events guaranteed to be from the queried account's transactions, or can events from other accounts leak? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/storage-interface/src/lib.rs] [Function: get_account_transaction_summaries()] [Version Range Validation] If both start_version and end_version are provided, is start_version <= end_version validated, or can this cause an empty/invalid range? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/storage-interface/src/lib.rs] [Function: get_account_transaction_summaries()] [Summary Consistency] Can IndexedTransactionSummary contain incorrect hash or replay protector values if the index is out of sync with transaction data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/storage-interface/src/lib.rs] [Function: get_account_transaction_summaries()] [Sorting Guarantee] Is the returned list always sorted by version ascending, or can concurrent indexing cause misordered results? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/storage-interface/src/lib.rs] [Function: get_state_proof_with_ledger_info()] [Ledger Info Validation] Is the provided LedgerInfoWithSignatures verified for valid signatures and quorum, or can an attacker provide a forged ledger_info? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/storage-interface/src/lib.rs] [Function: get_state_proof_with_ledger_info()] [Known Version Validation] If known_version > ledger_info.version(), can this return an invalid or empty StateProof? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/storage-interface/src/lib.rs] [Function: get_state_proof_with_ledger_info()] [Proof Completeness] Can the StateProof be missing critical consistency proofs, allowing clients to accept invalid state transitions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/storage-interface/src/lib.rs] [Function: get_state_proof()] [Latest Ledger Info] Does this use the latest committed ledger info, or can it use a stale one causing state proof verification failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/storage-interface/src/lib.rs] [Function: get_state_proof()] [Known Version Future] If known_version is in the future (>= latest version), does this error or return empty proof? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/storage-interface/src/lib.rs] [Function: get_state_value_by_version()] [Deleted State] If a StateKey was deleted at version V, does this return None or the last valid value before deletion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/storage-interface/src/lib.rs] [Function: get_state_value_by_version()] [Version Bound] If version > latest committed version, can this return pre-committed state values that aren't certified? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/storage-interface/src/lib.rs] [Function: get_state_value_by_version()] [StateKey Validation] Can a malformed StateKey cause incorrect database lookups or deserialization errors? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/storage-interface/src/lib.rs] [Function: get_state_value_with_version_by_version()] [Version Mismatch] Can the returned (Version, StateValue) pair be inconsistent, where the Version is when the key was last updated but StateValue is from a different version? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/storage-interface/src/lib.rs] [Function: get_state_value_with_version_by_version()] [Historical Version] If the state key exists at an old version but was deleted later, does this correctly return None when querying recent versions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/storage-interface/src/lib.rs] [Function: get_state_proof_by_version_ext()] [Root Depth Validation] Can root_depth be manipulated to return partial proofs that don't extend to the actual state root, enabling proof forgery? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/storage-interface/src/lib.rs] [Function: get_state_proof_by_version_ext()] [Key Hash Collision] If two StateKeys have the same hash, does this return the proof for the correct key? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/storage-interface/src/lib.rs] [Function: get_state_proof_by_version_ext()] [SparseMerkleProofExt Construction] Can the extended proof contain extra sibling hashes that don't belong to the merkle path, causing proof verification to accept invalid state? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/storage-interface/src/lib.rs] [Function: get_state_value_with_proof_by_version_ext()] [Value-Proof Consistency] Can the StateValue and SparseMerkleProofExt be from different versions due to concurrent updates, breaking proof verification? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/storage-interface/src/lib.rs] [Function: get_state_value_with_proof_by_version_ext()] [Proof Verification] Does the caller verify the returned proof against the state root, or is it trusted without verification? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/storage-interface/src/lib.rs] [Function: get_pre_committed_ledger_summary()] [Bootstrap State] Can this return a LedgerSummary before the database is properly bootstrapped, causing initialization failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/storage-interface/src/lib.rs] [Function: get_pre_committed_ledger_summary()] [Summary Consistency] Can the LedgerSummary contain inconsistent state root, transaction accumulator, and version information? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/storage-interface/src/lib.rs] [Function: get_persisted_state()] [HotStateView Consistency] Can the Arc<dyn HotStateView> and State be from different versions, causing state queries to return inconsistent results? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/storage-interface/src/lib.rs] [Function: get_persisted_state()] [State Lifetime] Can the HotStateView outlive the underlying state, causing use-after-free when querying persisted state? (High)
